body_html:
Ok @ramonh & @carpodaster I updated the full_time and part_time scopes on the Team model to also include the legacy terms (voluntary and sponsored). The accepted scope is then based on these two and all further occurences of explicitly using the contents of the KINDS constant.

TL;DR I implemented what I think @carpodaster suggested 😉

There is one leftover though: the recipient model still make use of Team::KINDS. I did not really understand the code there and the purpose why the KINDS are actually used 😹
It for now does not matter since this particular piece of code operates on current data anyways. I'll have a follow up PR where I update this.

Aside ☝️ I also included some small drive-by-fixes in the Team model, e.g. removing some no longer working associations and the duplicated selected scope. It it's too many changes, try looking at the individual commit messages.

body:
Ok @ramonh & @carpodaster I updated the `full_time` and `part_time` scopes on the `Team` model to also include the legacy terms *(`voluntary` and `sponsored`)*. The `accepted` scope is then based on these two and all further occurences of explicitly using the contents of the `KINDS` constant.

**TL;DR** I implemented what I think @carpodaster suggested 😉 

There is one leftover though: the `recipient` model still make use of `Team::KINDS`. I did not really understand the code there and the purpose why the `KINDS`  are actually used 😹 
It for now does not matter since this particular piece of code operates on current data anyways. I'll have a follow up PR where I update this.

Aside ☝️ I also included some small drive-by-fixes in the Team model, e.g. removing some no longer working associations and the duplicated `selected` scope. It it's too many changes, try looking at the individual commit messages.
